intro: Loncomelos brevistylum, commonly known as the short-stemmed thistle, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in moist, temperate climates and is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers are yellow and arranged in a dense cluster. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
